I'm working on a crawl where I only want pages that are subdirs of:

http://www.someserver.com/dir1/dir2/dir3/dir4/

and

http://www.someserver.com/dir5/dir6/

I've tried both PathScope and SurtPrefixScope, but I find that embeds
and redirects are not properly checked against my scope even though
scope-embedded-links is set to true.  For example, the URL
http://www.someserver.com/dir7/dir8/ might be accepted as in-scope if
its discovered purely through embeds (speculative and non) and
redirects.

I turned on all the logging I could and heritrix_out.log is
interesting (see below).  It appears the same URL is ruled in-scope,
then out-of-scope.  I'm now looking into DecidingScope, and thinking
maybe the ClassicScopes I was using had some implicit rule to allow
things from embeds even if they aren't in scope...is this the case?
If so, it should be documented a bit better and the log behavior in
such a case is confusing.  Any ideas?  Thanks, eric.
